inputs.name: taurusConfig
inputs.label: Taurus Configuration YAML
inputs.defaultValue:
execution:
- scenario:
    requests:
    - https://www.bing.com
    # You can also reference a JMeter test plan (recommended)
    # script: website-test.jmx
  concurrency: 5
  iterations: 10
  ramp-up: 2s

reporting:
- module: junit-xml
  filename: taurus-output/TEST-Taurus.xml
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional [Taurus YAML](https://gettaurus.org/docs/YAMLTutorial/) configuration file. You can also provide a path to a file in the *Taurus Arguments* field.

inputs.name: taurusArguments
inputs.label: Taurus Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: [Taurus command-line arguments](https://gettaurus.org/docs/CommandLine/): files or websites to test, can be the paths to one or more Taurus YAML definition files, JMeter files or website URLs. You can also provide configuration settings.

inputs.name: jmeterHome
inputs.label: JMeter Home
inputs.helpMarkDown: The directory in which JMeter is installed. Use `$(JMeterInstaller.JMeterHome)` to reference the output of the JMeter tool installer task.

inputs.name: jmeterPath
inputs.label: JMeter Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The location in which the JMeter executable is installed. Use `$(JMeterInstaller.JMeterPath)` to reference the output of the JMeter tool installer task.

inputs.name: jmeterVersion
inputs.label: JMeter Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The installed JMeter version. Use `$(JMeterInstaller.JMeterVersion)` to reference the output of the JMeter tool installer task.

inputs.name: outputDir
inputs.label: Artifacts output directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Taurus and JMeter output directory. Will contain a `report` directory with an HTML report, and a `TEST-Taurus.xml` file with a report in JUnit format.

inputs.name: reportName
inputs.label: Report name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the uploaded HTML report in build artifact (or build logs in a release pipeline). Set to empty not to generate a report.

messages.MustProvideConfigOrArgs: You must provide either a Taurus configuration YAML, or a path to a Taurus YAML / JMeter JMX file.
